Class Level

java.lang.Object
Level
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Level extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a level in the game, storing high scores and providing methods to manage level data and user scores. This class is responsible for adding high scores, managing file paths, and ensuring the high score list does not exceed the maximum number of entries.
Version:
1.0.2
Author:
Spas Dikov
See Also:

    • Level

      public Level(String levelName)
      Constructs a new Level with the specified name.
      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • getFilePath

      public String getFilePath()
      Returns the file path of the level's data file. The file is located under "src/resources/levels" with the level name as the file name.
      Returns:
      the file path of the level

    • getInProgressFilePath

      public String getInProgressFilePath()
      Returns the file path where the level's progress is saved. The file is located under "src/resources/saves" with the level name as the file name.
      Returns:
      the file path for saving the level progress

    • addUserScore

      public void addUserScore(User user, int score)
      Adds a user's score to the high scores list, maintaining the list size limit. If the list exceeds the maximum number of entries, the lowest score is removed.
      Parameters:
      user - the user whose score is to be added
      score - the score of the user

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the level's name and its high scores.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string containing the level name and its high scores

    • getHighScores

      public ArrayList<HighScore> getHighScores()
      Returns the list of high scores for this level.
      Returns:
      the list of high scores

    • getLevelName

      public String getLevelName()
      Returns the name of the level.
      Returns:
      the name of the level
